about.summary: Infers state-recorded gender categories from first names and dates of birth using historical datasets. By using these datasets instead of lists of male and female names, this package is able to more accurately infer the gender of a name, and it is able to report the probability that a name was male or female. GUIDELINES: This method must be used cautiously and responsibly. Please be sure to see the guidelines and warnings about usage in the 'README' or the package documentation. See Blevins and Mullen (2015) <http://www.digitalhumanities.org/dhq/vol/9/3/000223/000223.html>.

Infers state-recorded gender categories from first names and dates of birth using historical datasets. By using these datasets instead of lists of male and female names, this package is able to more accurately infer the gender of a name, and it is able to report the probability that a name was male or female. GUIDELINES: This method must be used cautiously and responsibly. Please be sure to see the guidelines and warnings about usage in the 'README' or the package documentation. See Blevins and Mullen (2015) <http://www.digitalhumanities.org/dhq/vol/9/3/000223/000223.html>.

name: r-gender
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.5.4' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-gender
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/gender_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/gender/gender_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: a40de85ccbb8ad329e9a01e41c1f0e3626ded6a26098d1c57e16cfff20b0117d

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr >=0.8.5
    - r-httr >=1.4.1
    - r-jsonlite >=1.6.1
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr >=0.8.5
    - r-httr >=1.4.1
    - r-jsonlite >=1.6.1

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('gender')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('gender')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://docs.ropensci.org/gender/, https://github.com/ropensci/gender
  license: MIT
  summary: 'Infers state-recorded gender categories from first names and dates of birth using
    historical datasets. By using these datasets instead of lists of male and female
    names, this package is able to more accurately infer the gender of a name, and it
    is able to report the probability that a name was male or female. GUIDELINES: This
    method must be used cautiously and responsibly. Please be sure to see the guidelines
    and warnings about usage in the ''README'' or the package documentation. See Blevins
    and Mullen (2015) <http://www.digitalhumanities.org/dhq/vol/9/3/000223/000223.html>.'
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - brendanf

# Package: gender
# Type: Package
# Title: Predict Gender from Names Using Historical Data
# Version: 0.5.4
# Date: 2020-05-12
# Authors@R: c(person("Lincoln", "Mullen", role = c("aut", "cre"), email = "lincoln@lincolnmullen.com", comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0001-5103-6917")), person("Cameron", "Blevins", role = "ctb"), person("Ben", "Schmidt", role = "ctb"))
# Description: Infers state-recorded gender categories from first names and dates of birth using historical datasets. By using these datasets instead of lists of male and female names, this package is able to more accurately infer the gender of a name, and it is able to report the probability that a name was male or female. GUIDELINES: This method must be used cautiously and responsibly. Please be sure to see the guidelines and warnings about usage in the 'README' or the package documentation. See Blevins and Mullen (2015) <http://www.digitalhumanities.org/dhq/vol/9/3/000223/000223.html>.
# URL: https://docs.ropensci.org/gender/, https://github.com/ropensci/gender
# Depends: R (>= 3.0.0), utils, stats
# Imports: dplyr (>= 0.8.5), httr (>= 1.4.1), jsonlite (>= 1.6.1)
# Suggests: genderdata (>= 0.5.0), ggplot2 (>= 3.3.0), knitr (>= 1.28), testthat (>= 2.3.2), rmarkdown (>= 2.1), covr
# Additional_repositories: http://packages.ropensci.org
# LazyData: yes
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# BugReports: https://github.com/ropensci/gender/issues
# RoxygenNote: 7.1.0
# Encoding: UTF-8
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2020-05-14 21:53:01 UTC; lmullen
# Author: Lincoln Mullen [aut, cre] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0001-5103-6917>), Cameron Blevins [ctb], Ben Schmidt [ctb]
# Maintainer: Lincoln Mullen <lincoln@lincolnmullen.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2020-05-15 09:10:02 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.10
